positive.review: Cool game, love the strategy parts, and the level of detail... :)

I really enjoy this game! I wanted a match 3 game just to mess around with but with a bit of depth and I do like gacha mechanics/hero collecting and this game has all that. I see people saying it's pay to win but I have been playing for a month or so and I am still progressing, earning new heroes, and can do a bunch of different kinds of game modes and I have spent no money and it's super fun. Maybe at ultra high levels it becomes P2W but I feel like I have played a LOT and no barriers so far. The troop abilities and team building is awesome. I played original Puzzle Quest way back when and this is scratching that itch and then some. 10/10 no notes.

This game is grind to win.
The more you grind the higher your daily reward.
And the higher your daily reward the more you do gacha.
So play when you feel doing it, or just receive their daily income
And become gacha addict later

As for the gameplay, you just need to be a little creative for a new player
REMEMBER THE GOAL IS TO FASTER GRIND NOT STRONGER TROOP
* AND BELIEVE THAT DAILY REWARD WILL DOMINATE THIS GAME
One of the best Match-3 game out there! I play either on Steam when I am at my desk or on Android when I am away and mobile.
If you had to choose just one match-3 game to take with you to a deserted island, it would be Gems of War.
This is a Gacha game for sure but you don't need to spend any money if you don't want too. That is what I like.
is a good game to kill time really and it scratches an ich for puzzle games
fun lil game, enjoyable for a few good hours, which is fine, since its free
So many options for characters to play, learning their various strengths, stratagy.
Forget Candy Crush !!!! This is the game =D
great game, review just for the reward :P
Good when you have nothing better to do.
it is a fun game good time killer
so cheap so trash but so fun

I don't understand all the people complaining about "pay to win" because I have 18 hours here and a bunch more on my phone and i've never spent a dime also people complaining that the bots play "impossible combos" are idiots its just being shafted by RNG which is a 2 way street. But nobody is going to complain about it when they get a quad combo off 1 move, its only when the enemy does it when it matters.

What an addictive game!

I wouldn't describe this game as P2W. Partake in the regular events, progress the story and join a guild and you'll have a pretty good team in no time. I regularly win events and rewards and they've not seen so much as a penny from me.

So far it works seamlessly between my phone and Steam (the only game in my library that does this). 

I had one minor problem on my phone, but that's because the game on the phone doesn't update like Steam does. It'll prompt you to manually update the game from the Play store and it'll be working again in no time.

So yeah, one minor problem in 3 solid months of gameplay is not a show-stopper.

Give it a try, you've got nothing to lose!
Cool game, love the strategy parts, and the level of detail... :)

I really enjoy this game! I wanted a match 3 game just to mess around with but with a bit of depth and I do like gacha mechanics/hero collecting and this game has all that. I see people saying it's pay to win but I have been playing for a month or so and I am still progressing, earning new heroes, and can do a bunch of different kinds of game modes and I have spent no money and it's super fun. Maybe at ultra high levels it becomes P2W but I feel like I have played a LOT and no barriers so far. The troop abilities and team building is awesome. I played original Puzzle Quest way back when and this is scratching that itch and then some. 10/10 no notes.

This game is grind to win.
The more you grind the higher your daily reward.
And the higher your daily reward the more you do gacha.
So play when you feel doing it, or just receive their daily income
And become gacha addict later

As for the gameplay, you just need to be a little creative for a new player
REMEMBER THE GOAL IS TO FASTER GRIND NOT STRONGER TROOP
* AND BELIEVE THAT DAILY REWARD WILL DOMINATE THIS GAME
it is like bejwled but less boring and has plot. lots of task to do. it is enjoyable. GEMS
One of the best Match-3 game out there! I play either on Steam when I am at my desk or on Android when I am away and mobile.
If you had to choose just one match-3 game to take with you to a deserted island, it would be Gems of War.
This is a Gacha game for sure but you don't need to spend any money if you don't want too. That is what I like.
is a good game to kill time really and it scratches an ich for puzzle games
fun lil game, enjoyable for a few good hours, which is fine, since its free
i like the game for someone who likes puzzle rpg is the perfect game, try it one time and you like it.

once a game with real charm and potential, Gems of War now feels like it's leaning too much into extracting money, trimming value, and ignoring player feedback. i‚Äôm playing less, enjoying less, and frankly regretting some of the microtransactions i made thinking this was a long-term commitment. if the devs don‚Äôt fix the support, balance, and paywall creep, i won‚Äôt be sticking around much longer

It's an OK game but has a fatal flaw...You can only follow the story line...If you come upon an area where the monsters are stronger there is no way to grind out XP...Its that next spot or nothing. I'll recommend it because it works fine but only having a story line to play is not fun.
A great Gem matching game, good for memory, and alot of intense battles.
So many options for characters to play, learning their various strengths, stratagy.

30.10.2025, good job guys this new upgrade literally fucuked game up, acsension is impossible anymore, bb ascend all button so how will we ascend hundreds of troops? 1 by 1 ? really ? with all my respect, fucuk your brain the 1 who made this dickish upgrade. ty fucukface.

Who knew matching gems could feel like leading an army of mythical monsters into battle? üíé‚öîÔ∏è
 Gems of War somehow turned my casual Candy Crush vibes into a full-blown RPG obsession.
You create your hero, collect over a thousand troops (yes, over a thousand), and suddenly you‚Äôre plotting kingdom conquests while your cat judges your life choices. The match-3 mechanics are smooth, satisfying, and actually strategic‚Äîskulls for direct damage, mana for abilities, and combos that make you feel like a tactical genius.
The campaign is massive, the PvP keeps you sweating, and the guild system adds just enough chaos to keep things spicy. Plus, cross-platform play means I can accidentally spend 3 hours on my phone and then pretend I was ‚Äúworking‚Äù on my PC.
Basically: Gems of War is Candy Crush meets Magic: The Gathering, with a sprinkle of Puzzle Quest nostalgia. Deep, addictive, and endlessly entertaining. 10/10, my gems are matched, my troops are leveled, and my social life is optional.
So far so good! Lots to do, but I think I'm close to beating the game :-)
Addictive match-3 game, where there is more to the strategy. :)
Super fun, lots to do. Endless deck building and delves and whatnot
Forget Candy Crush !!!! This is the game =D
great game, review just for the reward :P
ehh, it's alright I guess.
Feels like Gambling buts its just puzzle :) <3

negative.review: Worst computer player ever! The recommended moves are nearly always in the favor of the computer player.

Returned after a few years and this game has become completely unplayable as a beginner. The devs are clearly pushing into p2w aspect more and more. Oh well, another developer to put on the block list. Game was great a few years ago but now it's just impossible to even do the first area. Hell, even the tutorial area is hard because the cards you get are useless. Thanks for ruining yet another game. See ya
Constant ads to try to get you to spend money, ad nauseum.
Worst UI I've ever seen in a game
What is that? Why Steam say i'm plaing in... this?

You know what, This game has great bones. The concept and the game play is actually super solid. Buuut It is super predatory and is constantly begging for your money. It seems like every other screen asking you to buy something. Too bad. I would have loved to purchase this game for 5-10 bucks without all the pay to win spam.

It's a pay-to-win dumpster fire with generic match-3 mechanics. They treat their players like idiots and cut off their access to the servers without any warning. You decide if you want to get involved with a company like that.

I used to play this game years ago.
It was fun then.
Now it‚Äôs just a cash grab. They‚Äôve ramped up the difficulty for new users so you can barely play longer than an hour without being forced to make a purchase to progress.
It‚Äôs sad most games are following this pattern.

The most frustrating thing about this game... Is the fact that it is programmed to occasionally cheat you. The computer will make random moves that make no sense... Until the gems drop down for a perfect combo, granting them extra turns. It is very obvious that it was programmed to beat you. And then, of course, an add will pop up asking you to spend money to gain extras. It would honestly be a fun game if it wasn't for the fact that they deliberately screw you to try and get you to spend money.

Sooooooo pay A LOT to win (PA2W).  I loved the art work and the story telling.  I was introduced to this game on a gaming test site.  The music and artwork are really pleasant.  So yeah why not spend $9.99 to engage and enjoy the experience.  Now I'm at the point the battles are unwinable, the PvP the other players will crush you because they PA2W and you have to spend hours doing menial tasks and dailies to creep up to even have a chance.  No, I don't have time for this and there are much better game designed that this method.  Thins is like Mighty Party.  You will develop a card for only the developers to create new cards that will make your deck weak.  Look, I'm only 5hrs into this.  This is what $9.99 gets you.  Uninstalling............about.............NOW!

Returned after a few years and this game has become completely unplayable as a beginner. The devs are clearly pushing into p2w aspect more and more. Oh well, another developer to put on the block list. Game was great a few years ago but now it's just impossible to even do the first area. Hell, even the tutorial area is hard because the cards you get are useless. Thanks for ruining yet another game. See ya

I am profoundly disappointed with Gems of War and feel compelled to leave a negative review. The issues with this game are long-standing and show no signs of improvement.

Firstly, the developers' inaction regarding cheaters and hackers is absolutely appalling. PvP is rife with unfair play, completely undermining the game's balance and player experience. When the creators turn a blind eye to such blatant exploitation, it severely diminishes any sense of investment players might have.

Secondly, the game's operation strategy is baffling. It feels as though the development team is simply resting on its laurels, offering little in the way of innovation or substantial updates. Content updates are slow, and there's a distinct lack of fresh gameplay, leading to an increasingly stale and unengaging experience.

Furthermore, the grind in this game is utterly insane. Acquiring most powerful cards requires an incredibly long-term commitment to progression and farming. For new players, PvP is an absolute nightmare; you'll have virtually no enjoyable experience as you simply cannot compete with veterans who have accumulated years of resources. This makes the game incredibly unfriendly to newcomers, with an absurdly high barrier to entry.

Lastly, and perhaps most egregious, is the dreadful monetization system. The value proposition of in-game bundles is practically non-existent, bordering on insulting to players' intelligence. I genuinely marvel at anyone willing to spend money on such worthless packages. This greedy business model, combined with all the aforementioned problems, makes it impossible for me to recommend this game.

In summary, Gems of War is a poorly managed, cheat-ridden, excessively grindy, extremely unfriendly to new players, and monetarily exploitative game. If you're looking for a game with a good long-term experience, steer clear of this one.

I love this game, but it no longer supports cross platform save sharing. I have a 90+ character that I can only access on my phone. This used to have cross platform support, once upon a time, but I guess the devs decided to take that feature away for some reason. Now I have zero interest in playing this game on pc because despite having steam achievements, I have to start over from scratch. Bad game design decision- don't take things away from players after you have implemented them, it only makes them resent you.
Worst computer player ever! The recommended moves are nearly always in the favor of the computer player.
ads everywhere, bots will blow you up, rewards will gone. only remind me this game actually not bad at first 3 years.
Constant ads to try to get you to spend money, ad nauseum.
Worst UI I've ever seen in a game

Sooooooo pay A LOT to win (PA2W).  I loved the art work and the story telling.  I was introduced to this game on a gaming test site.  The music and artwork are really pleasant.  So yeah why not spend $9.99 to engage and enjoy the experience.  Now I'm at the point the battles are unwinable, the PvP the other players will crush you because they PA2W and you have to spend hours doing menial tasks and dailies to creep up to even have a chance.  No, I don't have time for this and there are much better game designed that this method.  Thins is like Mighty Party.  You will develop a card for only the developers to create new cards that will make your deck weak.  Look, I'm only 5hrs into this.  This is what $9.99 gets you.  Uninstalling............about.............NOW!

Returned after a few years and this game has become completely unplayable as a beginner. The devs are clearly pushing into p2w aspect more and more. Oh well, another developer to put on the block list. Game was great a few years ago but now it's just impossible to even do the first area. Hell, even the tutorial area is hard because the cards you get are useless. Thanks for ruining yet another game. See ya

I am profoundly disappointed with Gems of War and feel compelled to leave a negative review. The issues with this game are long-standing and show no signs of improvement.

Firstly, the developers' inaction regarding cheaters and hackers is absolutely appalling. PvP is rife with unfair play, completely undermining the game's balance and player experience. When the creators turn a blind eye to such blatant exploitation, it severely diminishes any sense of investment players might have.

Secondly, the game's operation strategy is baffling. It feels as though the development team is simply resting on its laurels, offering little in the way of innovation or substantial updates. Content updates are slow, and there's a distinct lack of fresh gameplay, leading to an increasingly stale and unengaging experience.

Furthermore, the grind in this game is utterly insane. Acquiring most powerful cards requires an incredibly long-term commitment to progression and farming. For new players, PvP is an absolute nightmare; you'll have virtually no enjoyable experience as you simply cannot compete with veterans who have accumulated years of resources. This makes the game incredibly unfriendly to newcomers, with an absurdly high barrier to entry.

Lastly, and perhaps most egregious, is the dreadful monetization system. The value proposition of in-game bundles is practically non-existent, bordering on insulting to players' intelligence. I genuinely marvel at anyone willing to spend money on such worthless packages. This greedy business model, combined with all the aforementioned problems, makes it impossible for me to recommend this game.

In summary, Gems of War is a poorly managed, cheat-ridden, excessively grindy, extremely unfriendly to new players, and monetarily exploitative game. If you're looking for a game with a good long-term experience, steer clear of this one.

I love this game, but it no longer supports cross platform save sharing. I have a 90+ character that I can only access on my phone. This used to have cross platform support, once upon a time, but I guess the devs decided to take that feature away for some reason. Now I have zero interest in playing this game on pc because despite having steam achievements, I have to start over from scratch. Bad game design decision- don't take things away from players after you have implemented them, it only makes them resent you.
Worst computer player ever! The recommended moves are nearly always in the favor of the computer player.
ads everywhere, bots will blow you up, rewards will gone. only remind me this game actually not bad at first 3 years.
Constant ads to try to get you to spend money, ad nauseum.
Worst UI I've ever seen in a game
What is that? Why Steam say i'm plaing in... this?
yup

You know what, This game has great bones. The concept and the game play is actually super solid. Buuut It is super predatory and is constantly begging for your money. It seems like every other screen asking you to buy something. Too bad. I would have loved to purchase this game for 5-10 bucks without all the pay to win spam.

It's a pay-to-win dumpster fire with generic match-3 mechanics. They treat their players like idiots and cut off their access to the servers without any warning. You decide if you want to get involved with a company like that.

I used to play this game years ago.
It was fun then.
Now it‚Äôs just a cash grab. They‚Äôve ramped up the difficulty for new users so you can barely play longer than an hour without being forced to make a purchase to progress.
It‚Äôs sad most games are following this pattern.

The most frustrating thing about this game... Is the fact that it is programmed to occasionally cheat you. The computer will make random moves that make no sense... Until the gems drop down for a perfect combo, granting them extra turns. It is very obvious that it was programmed to beat you. And then, of course, an add will pop up asking you to spend money to gain extras. It would honestly be a fun game if it wasn't for the fact that they deliberately screw you to try and get you to spend money.
